forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of smoke. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55. Southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.shortForecast: Areas Of Smoke then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of smoke before 10am. Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 10 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city finds itself draped in a veil of smoke, adding an unusual layer to the typical morning chill. A low murmur of clouds hovers above, with temperatures lingering around a mild 55 degrees. The southwest wind whispers through the streets, offering a gentle company to those venturing out early. With the promise of clarity later in the day, one can expect the haze to lift as the sun rises higher, casting warmth and revealing the colors of the city once more. 

Sunday promises an evolution in conditions; the smoke is expected to dissipate before 10 AM, giving way to mostly sunny skies, though the afternoon will see temperatures fall back to around 61 degrees. As the brisk winds pick up, gusting up to 31 mph, it may feel cooler than it appears. Dressing in layers would be wise; a light jacket or sweater would provide comfort against the wind, while breathable fabrics could keep one cool as the sun makes its presence known. Given the mixed weather sensations, a leisurely morning walk along the Embarcadero could be invigorating, followed by coffee at a nearby café where one can enjoy the gradual transformation of the city and the resumption of its vibrant life.
